contentList.content: Monk’s Discipline

Your self-discipline and martial training allow you to harness a well of extraordinary energy within yourself. You can spend <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">these points</LSTag> to fuel advanced monk techniques.

You start knowing three such features: <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="CL_Target_OneDnD_FlurryOfBlows_FirstStrike">Flurry of Blows</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="CL_Shout_OneDnD_PatientDefense">Patient Defense</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="CL_Shout_OneDnD_StepOfTheWind">Step of the Wind</LSTag>.
Discipline Point(s)
Flurry of Blows
Make two <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_UnarmedAttack">Unarmed Strikes</LSTag> as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>.
Flurry of Blows: Second Strike
Make a follow up <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_UnarmedAttack">Unarmed Strikes</LSTag>.
Step of the Wind: Dash
Double your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag>. Jump no longer requires a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>.
Step of the Wind
Jumping no longer requires a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>.
Patient Defence

<LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against you have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>, and you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
Deflect Attacks

Use your reaction to reduce the damage from a weapon attack by 1d10 + your Dexterity Modifier + your monk level.

If the damage is reduced to 0, you use a Ki Point to Deflect the Attack.
You can only reduce damage from the attack - any additional effects can't be negated.
